roleset.name: act towards an entity in a certain manner, assume that something has a particular attribute
roleset.note: TREAT-V NOTES: Comparison to describe. Member of Vncls characterize-29.2 (from treat.01-v)
TREATMENT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry treat.01; corresponds to Vncls characterize-29.2 (from treatment.01-n)

example.name: treat-v: passive
example.text: [Interest on the bonds]-1 will be treated *trace*-1 as a preference item in calculating the federal alternative minimum tax that may be imposed on certain investors.
example.arg: in calculating the federal alternative minimum tax that may be imposed on certain investors

example.name: treat-v: active
example.text: Mary treats John like an idiot, which he is.
example.arg: like an idiot, which he is

example.name: treatment-n: All arguments
example.text: His treatment of Tanabai as if he were an equal angered the higher-ups because they interpreted his deference to Tanabai as covering up for a friend.
example.arg: as if he were an equal

example.name: treatment-n: No agent
example.text: It is tempting to view the treatment of children as chattel as unique to Third World communist countries.

example.name: treatment-n
example.text: They also decried Libya 's treatment of the migrants and its poor human rights record .

roleset.name: buy for someone
roleset.note: TREAT-V NOTES: Comparison to give. Member of Vncls equip-13.4.2-1. Updated by Julia. (from treat.02-v)

example.name: treat-v: there is such a thing as a free lunch

roleset.name: medical treatment
roleset.note: TREATMENT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry treat.03; No Vncls. (from treatment.02-n)

example.name: treat-v: passive with injury
example.text: [The injured, including three in critical condition,]-1 were treated *trace*-1 for burns, breathing problems and cuts from flying glass, hospital officials said.
example.arg: for burns, breathing problems and cuts from flying glass

example.name: treat-v: instrumental subject
example.text: Sales of Pfizer's important drugs, [Feldene]-1 for *trace*-1 treating arthritis, and Procardia, a heart medicine, have shrunk because of increased competition.

example.name: treat-v: active transitive
example.text: By the time it paid its expenses [it]-1 only had $120,000 left -- not enough *trace*-1 to treat even one child.

example.name: treatment-n: Doctor and patient only
example.note: This one is somewhat on the fence with treat.01, but since it's clearly a medical domain, we'll leave it here.
example.text: Humor is a major ingredient in the doctor's treatment of the patient.

example.name: treatment-n: Illness only
example.text: Being misdiagnosed with depression is a potentially dangerous problem because the treatment for bipolar depression is different than for regular depression.

example.name: treatment-n: Instrument and illness
example.text: The current standard for chemotherapy treatment of breast cancer is 6-cycles spaced 21-days apart.

roleset.name: affect a change in something by applying a substance
roleset.note: TREAT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'treat' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. (from treat.04-v predicate notes)
TREATMENT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry treat.04; no VN class. (from treatment.03-n)

example.name: treat-v: missing substance
example.text: Seymour Schreibman, the 65-year-old owner of Schreibman Raphael Furs Inc., treats the reverse side of a Persian lambskin to produce a reversible fur-and-leather garment.
example.arg: Seymour Schreibman, the 65-year-old owner of Schreibman Raphael Furs Inc.
the reverse side of a Persian lambskin
to produce a reversible fur-and-leather garment

example.name: treatment-n: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The treatment of wood with sucrose and invert sugar solutions greatly reduces the subsequent shrinkage.
example.arg: with sucrose and invert sugar solutions

example.name: treatment-n: Water treatment
example.text: Treatment of water areas with fish toxicants must be done by one of these biologists per Illinois Administrative Rule 890.

roleset.name: handle (esp scholarly)
roleset.note: TREATMENT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry treat.05; No Vncls. (from treatment.04-n)

example.name: treat-v: postmodern angst
example.text: It is evident that their conversation runs more or less on the following lines: ``I've submitted the manuscript of my novel under the title `Teresa de Cepeda,' and in it I've treated a few neglected aspects of that eternal problem which...''
example.arg: a few neglected aspects of that eternal problem which...''

example.name: treatment-n: Typical usage
example.text: Descriptively, the author's treatment of his subject and material is splendid, and quite complete.

roleset.name: able to be treated, medically
roleset.note: TREATABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-seedcorpus. Relation to 'treat.03'. (from treatable.01-j)

example.name: treatable-j: arg1
example.text: It is understood that local recurrence can often be treated with curative intent with a second surgery , but the distant recurrence , ie metastatic disease is treatable but not curable .
example.arg: the distant recurrence , ie metastatic disease
